meanings.definition: The quality of being sour or acidic in taste.
meanings.sent1: I could taste the tartness of the lemon in the pie.
meanings.sent2: The tartness of the vinegar added a zing to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The tartness of the orange made my face pucker up.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a tartness that left a bitter aftertaste.
meanings.sent5: The tartness of the green apple was refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.definition: The state of being sharp or cutting in manner or tone.
meanings.sent1: His comment had a tartness that caught me off guard.
meanings.sent2: The tartness of her reply made me realize she was upset.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tartness, he always had a twinkle in his eye.
meanings.sent4: The tartness of her criticism stung more than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The tartness in her voice hinted at hidden frustration.
